We believe diversity, equity, and inclusion challenges require human-centric solutions, centered on the needs of those who are the most historically marginalized. We have learned that equity is a systemic outcome of the work done within the spaces of diversity , inclusion , and anti-oppression . We know sustainable change happens in an ecosystem of aligned leaders and strong governance. Deloitte’s Equity Services identify and address the root causes and interrelationships of systemic problems to drive outcomes and impact—both within and outside of your organization.
Hear from Deloitte Equity Services leaders about our perspective on equity and our service offerings

{"@context":"http://schema.org","@type":"VideoObject","name":"Deloitte Equity Services","description":"Hear from Deloitte Equity Services leaders about our perspective on equity and our service offerings","thumbnailUrl":"http://img.youtube.com/vi/M1jMHORn1hY/0.jpg","uploadDate":"2023-10-02T13:32:34Z"}
Get to know our Equity Professional Services
Deloitte’s differentiated point of view informs our approach to equity professional services
This fundamental framework serves as the foundation for all of Deloitte’s Equity Services.
Are you ready to take action? Contact usdeiservices@deloitte.com to learn more about how our services can help your organization activate equity.

Deloitte refers to one or more of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee ("DTTL"), its network of member firms, and their related entities. DTTL and each of its member firms are legally separate and independent entities. DTTL (also referred to as "Deloitte Global") does not provide services to clients. In the United States, Deloitte refers to one or more of the US member firms of DTTL, their related entities that operate using the "Deloitte" name in the United States and their respective affiliates. Certain services may not be available to attest clients under the rules and regulations of public accounting. Please see www.deloitte.com/about to learn more about our global network of member firms.
insight: Inspiring connections. Impactful work. All here. All waiting to be discovered by you. When you join our Talent Network, you're connecting to career resources that provide insights into working at Deloitte and potential job opportunities. Let's get started.
interactive data visualizations and powerful insights
Sharing insights, events, research, and more

jQuery(document).ready(function($) {
        
        
        //add dstory plugin
        $('#dstoryauditandassurance').storiescarousel({
            properties: {
                fragID: "dstoryauditandassurance",
                numberOfItems: "18", // number of items in carousel : default 1

The Deloitte Center for Board Effectiveness helps directors fulfill their oversight responsibility to the organizations they serve throughout their board service.
Our professionals provide independent financial statement and internal control audit services, in accordance with the latest professional standards and with a focus on quality.
Non-financial metrics are key value drivers. Find out how our corporate sustainability reporting services are helping businesses move beyond the financial statements.

Deloitte refers to one or more of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee ("DTTL"), its network of member firms, and their related entities. DTTL and each of its member firms are legally separate and independent entities. DTTL (also referred to as "Deloitte Global") does not provide services to clients. In the United States, Deloitte refers to one or more of the US member firms of DTTL, their related entities that operate using the "Deloitte" name in the United States and their respective affiliates. Certain services may not be available to attest clients under the rules and regulations of public accounting. Please see www.deloitte.com/about to learn more about our global network of member firms.

DP Services Hub Page 2024. Do not delete! This box/component contains JavaScript that is needed on this page.
		This message will not be visible when page is activated.

Family enterprise Private equity Emerging growth
                      companies Private companies It means family There's a lot of joy in family businesses and family offices. There's a lot of strategy, hard work, and challenging decisions, too. Your focus on purpose and stewardship can help you create something enduring that's passed on to future generations. We understand the unique complexities family enterprises face, and we can serve you as you assess today's opportunities to create tomorrow's legacy. Visit our family enterprise page It means value The need to create value never abates—whether you're facing headwinds or tailwinds. We get it. We can advise you on ways you can keep your promise to investors and owner-entrepreneurs--whether to optimize revenue and profitability, spur growth and innovation, or increase value across the ecosystem of funds and portfolio companies. It means growth High-growth companies are powering innovation in the broader economy. Many of these startups can become dominant in their categories or create entirely new categories. Each emerging growth company (EGC) has unique needs and issues at different stages of growth. As your startup grows, we can tailor our approach to advise you on your journey toward a public exit. It means experience Private companies should stay nimble because even among uncertainty, there can be opportunity. We advise you through our firsthand insights and demonstrated private company services as you work to bolster your infrastructure, attract and retain talent, and boost organic and inorganic growth.

Private companies should stay nimble because even among uncertainty, there can be opportunity. We advise you through our firsthand insights and demonstrated private company services as you work to bolster your infrastructure, attract and retain talent, and boost organic and inorganic growth.

Your business needs tailored strategies and services to meet its objectives. Work with a local lead contact who can coordinate with our network of resources—comprising audit & assurance, tax, consulting, and risk & financial advisory professionals.

Your business may need recommendations and services that consider the challenges—and resulting opportunities—that could be on the horizon. To that end, we explore the market from micro to macro to advise private enterprises like yours on ways you can make a lasting impression.
As one of the leading professional services organizations in the wine industry, we have a passion for advising wineries on how to turn today's challenges into tomorrow's opportunities.
“Your business journey is one-of-a-kind, and we take great pride in tailoring our services to meet your business needs, every step of the way.” —Wolfe Tone

“The investing mindset is constantly evolving based on real-time trends and long-term impact. Our services are designed to advise you as you position your company at the intersection of today and tomorrow.” —Heather Gates

service:
Bring your bold aspirations to Deloitte. We're the leading provider of end-to-end mergers,
					acquisitions, and restructuring services. Like you, our experienced
					professionals have a bold sense of purpose, and the skills and knowledge to challenge the status quo
					and make your vision a reality.

Deloitte's M&A and Restructuring services can help you answer these
								questions and others with more certainty and less delay.

Where flexibility meets focus, our comprehensive, highly customized M&A services become
					high-impact M&A solutions.

Combined with Deloitte's deep industry knowledge, holistic approach, advanced technologies, and
					accelerated process, our M&A services enable you to confidently
					move forward with speed and agility—because we know you don't have a single moment to spare.

Each merger, acquisition, joint venture, or divestiture is a journey of definition and
							discovery. Deloitte's M&A strategy services help you articulate
							transaction objectives, weigh market opportunities and risks, and evaluate the ways a deal
							may or may not offer the growth or capabilities the business
							needs.

An organization approaching an M&A transaction needs a solid baseline of self-awareness and
							preparation. What do you want to achieve? What are you
							capable of? Deloitte's transaction readiness services assist leaders and stakeholders in
							finding, weighing, and comparing potential targets.

When faced with financial volatility or economic uncertainty, the path you choose is more than reactionary—it can become
							a chance to grow. Deloitte offers a tailored set of services focused on improving cash flow, driving organizational
							value, and delivering longer-term planning that can turn daunting challenges into an avenue for growth.
Deloitte's Restructuring services change, reconfigure, and reshape your organization

Our team: Every deal is different, and the path to value creation is
					unique. The ability to bring an industry view to an M&A and
					Restructuring transaction is perhaps more important now than ever before. Our end-to-end services
					are customized to meet the unique needs of any client, with an
					industry and sector emphasis to help define the right strategy, realize your goals, and identify
					future opportunities. Our team has the industry knowledge,
					depth of resources and breadth of capabilities to bring you the unique combination of skills your
					transaction requires.
Mergers, Acquisitions, and Restructuring Financial Services Industry Leader Principal, Deloitte Consulting LLP

insight: Inspiring connections. Impactful work. All here. All waiting to be discovered by you. When you join our Talent Network, you're connecting to career resources that provide insights into working at Deloitte and potential job opportunities. Let's get started.
Insights from our 2024 ESG in M&A trends survey

We provide the right insights, capabilities, and support at the right time so you can anticipate what's
				around the corner, effectively prepare your organization for
				change, and boost deal effectiveness. Want to succeed in ways you've never imagined? Bring your bold
				aspirations to Deloitte.
Rethinking business margin improvement strategies: 6 bold insights from the 2024 MarginPLUS study

The economic uncertainty of 2023 was not vastly different from challenging periods of the past. The way many organizations responded to it, though, marked a bold shift. The insights from our 2024 MarginPLUS study of more than 300 business leaders show a move in favor of a more strategic and focused approach.

Regulatory compliance and legal services that help you lean in
Accelerating financial crime risk and related regulatory requirements for financial services institutions

Deloitte Regulatory & Legal services is dedicated to helping organizations in their efforts to achieve regulatory and legal compliance and transform their departments to add greater value to the business. It’s not just about managing risk and vulnerabilities; our regulatory and legal services put threats on defense—from global corruption to fraud. Our in-depth experience takes the complexity out of enterprise compliance. And we combine highly specialized skills in discovery and data management, corporate investigations, Foreign Corrupt Practices Act, and anti-fraud with financial acumen and advanced analytics to produce transformative insights.

Deloitte refers to one or more of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee ("DTTL"), its network of member firms, and their related entities. An initial public offering (IPO) is an important event in the life of an organization as they seek to grow or provide liquidity to early investors and employees. In the fifth edition of this report, we explore recent trends, regulations, market shifts that impact the IPO process, and outline strategies to help your organization prepare for going public.

service: Your path to possible is wide open. Deloitte’s cloud services can help you realize your organization's unique cloud advantage.

Deloitte has acquired substantially all of the assets of Giant Machines, a digital product company based in New York City. The Giant Machines business is focused on strategizing, designing and engineering innovative digital products. The acquisition will greatly expand our Deloitte Engineering and Deloitte Digital end-to-end digital product strategy and development capabilities, offering clients a robust suite of solutioning services.
Analysts recognize Deloitte’s industry-specific cloud experience and our global leadership in cloud strategy, services, and innovation.

Operate and innovate : Operating in a cloud environment can be challenging—and operating multicloud and hybrid models only increases that complexity. Our Cloud Operate Services provide infrastructure management, as well as compliance and cybersecurity services, delivering resilient and reliable operations for enterprise cloud workloads. By combining our Cloud Managed Services with other offerings, we can deliver business outcomes as a set of cloud-hosted, scalable, and on-demand services to help you innovate and realize the full value of your cloud.

We believe diversity, equity, and inclusion challenges require human-centric solutions, centered on the needs of those who are the most historically marginalized. We have learned that equity is a systemic outcome of the work done within the spaces of diversity , inclusion , and anti-oppression . We know sustainable change happens in an ecosystem of aligned leaders and strong governance. Deloitte’s Equity Services identify and address the root causes and interrelationships of systemic problems to drive outcomes and impact—both within and outside of your organization.
Hear from Deloitte Equity Services leaders about our perspective on equity and our service offerings

{"@context":"http://schema.org","@type":"VideoObject","name":"Deloitte Equity Services","description":"Hear from Deloitte Equity Services leaders about our perspective on equity and our service offerings","thumbnailUrl":"http://img.youtube.com/vi/M1jMHORn1hY/0.jpg","uploadDate":"2023-10-02T13:32:34Z"}
Get to know our Equity Professional Services
Deloitte’s differentiated point of view informs our approach to equity professional services
This fundamental framework serves as the foundation for all of Deloitte’s Equity Services.
Are you ready to take action? Contact usdeiservices@deloitte.com to learn more about how our services can help your organization activate equity.

Deloitte refers to one or more of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee ("DTTL"), its network of member firms, and their related entities. DTTL and each of its member firms are legally separate and independent entities. DTTL (also referred to as "Deloitte Global") does not provide services to clients. In the United States, Deloitte refers to one or more of the US member firms of DTTL, their related entities that operate using the "Deloitte" name in the United States and their respective affiliates. Certain services may not be available to attest clients under the rules and regulations of public accounting. Please see www.deloitte.com/about to learn more about our global network of member firms.
insight: Inspiring connections. Impactful work. All here. All waiting to be discovered by you. When you join our Talent Network, you're connecting to career resources that provide insights into working at Deloitte and potential job opportunities. Let's get started.
interactive data visualizations and powerful insights
Sharing insights, events, research, and more

service: The future of financial services is a “higher” bottom line.
Welcome to a new era of financial services.
Dedicated to providing services for your team and your business to help make the world a better place.
Emerging developments and trends in the financial services industry
Emerging developments and trends in the financial services industry

Deloitte is committed to being the provider of choice for industry leaders and
                    organizations aspiring to shape and lead the future of financial services.
Financial services in an era of discontinuities

The first computers designed for business use were introduced to the workplace nearly 70 years ago. Today, a steady stream of innovative technological and scientific developments is constantly ushering in new breakthroughs that continue to impact the financial services sector—where trust is fundamental and security is essential. At this rate, how will the world in 2030 differ from our world today?
The digital transformation of financial services organizations is extending into ecosystems, introducing new players and shifting traditional roles.
To help mitigate the effects of global warming, the financial services industry can play an integral role in bringing climate innovations and technologies to the world.

insight: Inspiring connections. Impactful work. All here. All waiting to be discovered by you. When you join our Talent Network, you're connecting to career resources that provide insights into working at Deloitte and potential job opportunities. Let's get started.

Deloitte IndustryAdvantage offers deep industry insights with cutting-edge digital capabilities to position your business for the future. Explore how we can help you face your commercial, product, and operations challenges and gain a competitive advantage.

service: Your path to possible is wide open. Deloitte’s cloud services can help you realize your organization's unique cloud advantage.

Deloitte has acquired substantially all of the assets of Giant Machines, a digital product company based in New York City. The Giant Machines business is focused on strategizing, designing and engineering innovative digital products. The acquisition will greatly expand our Deloitte Engineering and Deloitte Digital end-to-end digital product strategy and development capabilities, offering clients a robust suite of solutioning services.
Analysts recognize Deloitte’s industry-specific cloud experience and our global leadership in cloud strategy, services, and innovation.

Operate and innovate : Operating in a cloud environment can be challenging—and operating multicloud and hybrid models only increases that complexity. Our Cloud Operate Services provide infrastructure management, as well as compliance and cybersecurity services, delivering resilient and reliable operations for enterprise cloud workloads. By combining our Cloud Managed Services with other offerings, we can deliver business outcomes as a set of cloud-hosted, scalable, and on-demand services to help you innovate and realize the full value of your cloud.

service:
Bring your bold aspirations to Deloitte. We're the leading provider of end-to-end mergers,
					acquisitions, and restructuring services. Like you, our experienced
					professionals have a bold sense of purpose, and the skills and knowledge to challenge the status quo
					and make your vision a reality.

Deloitte's M&A and Restructuring services can help you answer these
								questions and others with more certainty and less delay.

Where flexibility meets focus, our comprehensive, highly customized M&A services become
					high-impact M&A solutions.

Combined with Deloitte's deep industry knowledge, holistic approach, advanced technologies, and
					accelerated process, our M&A services enable you to confidently
					move forward with speed and agility—because we know you don't have a single moment to spare.

Each merger, acquisition, joint venture, or divestiture is a journey of definition and
							discovery. Deloitte's M&A strategy services help you articulate
							transaction objectives, weigh market opportunities and risks, and evaluate the ways a deal
							may or may not offer the growth or capabilities the business
							needs.

An organization approaching an M&A transaction needs a solid baseline of self-awareness and
							preparation. What do you want to achieve? What are you
							capable of? Deloitte's transaction readiness services assist leaders and stakeholders in
							finding, weighing, and comparing potential targets.

When faced with financial volatility or economic uncertainty, the path you choose is more than reactionary—it can become
							a chance to grow. Deloitte offers a tailored set of services focused on improving cash flow, driving organizational
							value, and delivering longer-term planning that can turn daunting challenges into an avenue for growth.
Deloitte's Restructuring services change, reconfigure, and reshape your organization

Our team: Every deal is different, and the path to value creation is
					unique. The ability to bring an industry view to an M&A and
					Restructuring transaction is perhaps more important now than ever before. Our end-to-end services
					are customized to meet the unique needs of any client, with an
					industry and sector emphasis to help define the right strategy, realize your goals, and identify
					future opportunities. Our team has the industry knowledge,
					depth of resources and breadth of capabilities to bring you the unique combination of skills your
					transaction requires.
Mergers, Acquisitions, and Restructuring Financial Services Industry Leader Principal, Deloitte Consulting LLP

I agree to receive emailed reports, articles, event invitations and other information related to Deloitte products and services. I understand I may unsubscribe at any time by clicking the link included in emails. *

Deloitte refers to one or more of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee ("DTTL"), its network of member firms, and their related entities. DTTL and each of its member firms are legally separate and independent entities. DTTL (also referred to as "Deloitte Global") does not provide services to clients. In the United States, Deloitte refers to one or more of the US member firms of DTTL, their related entities that operate using the "Deloitte" name in the United States and their respective affiliates. Certain services may not be available to attest clients under the rules and regulations of public accounting. Please see www.deloitte.com/about to learn more about our global network of member firms.
insight: Inspiring connections. Impactful work. All here. All waiting to be discovered by you. When you join our Talent Network, you're connecting to career resources that provide insights into working at Deloitte and potential job opportunities. Let's get started.
Insights from our 2024 ESG in M&A trends survey

We provide the right insights, capabilities, and support at the right time so you can anticipate what's
				around the corner, effectively prepare your organization for
				change, and boost deal effectiveness. Want to succeed in ways you've never imagined? Bring your bold
				aspirations to Deloitte.
Rethinking business margin improvement strategies: 6 bold insights from the 2024 MarginPLUS study

The economic uncertainty of 2023 was not vastly different from challenging periods of the past. The way many organizations responded to it, though, marked a bold shift. The insights from our 2024 MarginPLUS study of more than 300 business leaders show a move in favor of a more strategic and focused approach.

The Deloitte Center for Board Effectiveness helps directors fulfill their oversight responsibility to the organizations they serve throughout their board service.
Our professionals provide independent financial statement and internal control audit services, in accordance with the latest professional standards and with a focus on quality.
Non-financial metrics are key value drivers. Find out how our corporate sustainability reporting services are helping businesses move beyond the financial statements.

Deloitte refers to one or more of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee ("DTTL"), its network of member firms, and their related entities. DTTL and each of its member firms are legally separate and independent entities. DTTL (also referred to as "Deloitte Global") does not provide services to clients. In the United States, Deloitte refers to one or more of the US member firms of DTTL, their related entities that operate using the "Deloitte" name in the United States and their respective affiliates. Certain services may not be available to attest clients under the rules and regulations of public accounting. Please see www.deloitte.com/about to learn more about our global network of member firms.

insight: Inspiring connections. Impactful work. All here. All waiting to be discovered by you. When you join our Talent Network, you're connecting to career resources that provide insights into working at Deloitte and potential job opportunities. Let's get started.

Gain insight into issues that arise from major accounting events and business transactions such as an IPO, merger, acquisition, divestiture, joint venture, and more.

The third edition of the Audit Committee Practices Report: Common Threads Across Audit Committees, a collaboration between Deloitte's Center for Board Effectiveness and the Center for Audit Quality, provides insight into audit committee priorities, emerging trends, and committee practices.

service:
DP Services Hub Page 2024. Do not delete! This box/component contains JavaScript that is needed on this page.
		This message will not be visible when page is activated.

Family enterprise Private equity Emerging growth
                      companies Private companies It means family There's a lot of joy in family businesses and family offices. There's a lot of strategy, hard work, and challenging decisions, too. Your focus on purpose and stewardship can help you create something enduring that's passed on to future generations. We understand the unique complexities family enterprises face, and we can serve you as you assess today's opportunities to create tomorrow's legacy. Visit our family enterprise page It means value The need to create value never abates—whether you're facing headwinds or tailwinds. We get it. We can advise you on ways you can keep your promise to investors and owner-entrepreneurs--whether to optimize revenue and profitability, spur growth and innovation, or increase value across the ecosystem of funds and portfolio companies. It means growth High-growth companies are powering innovation in the broader economy. Many of these startups can become dominant in their categories or create entirely new categories. Each emerging growth company (EGC) has unique needs and issues at different stages of growth. As your startup grows, we can tailor our approach to advise you on your journey toward a public exit. It means experience Private companies should stay nimble because even among uncertainty, there can be opportunity. service: Paul is a partner with Deloitte & Touche LLP and leads Deloitte’s US Executive Accelerators (XA) in Client & Market Growth (CMG), and also serves as Vice Chair and Deloitte US Technology Sector Leader. Previously, Paul led Deloitte’s Technology, Media & Telecommunications (TMT) industry practice in Risk & Financial Advisory, and worked as an auditor in the Audit & Assurance business. With more than 35 years of professional services experience, Paul also serves as an advisory partner for a select number of Deloitte’s most strategic global technology clients. Additionally, Paul is the Deloitte US executive sponsor of the Catalyst Tel Aviv Program, which helps US clients interested in innovation engage with the 6,000+ Israeli start-up community.

Paul specializes in leadership development, crisis management, digital enterprise transformation, business continuity, change management, and identifying the resources within our organization to help clients address their most complex issues and professional service needs. He is conversationally fluent in German and has gained international experience by working for two years for Deloitte Switzerland.

service: Deloitte refers to one or more of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee ("DTTL"), its network of member firms, and their related entities. DTTL and each of its member firms are legally separate and independent entities. DTTL (also referred to as "Deloitte Global") does not provide services to clients. In the United States, Deloitte refers to one or more of the US member firms of DTTL, their related entities that operate using the "Deloitte" name in the United States and their respective affiliates. Certain services may not be available to attest clients under the rules and regulations of public accounting. Please see www.deloitte.com/about to learn more about our global network of member firms.
insight: Inspiring connections. Impactful work. All here. All waiting to be discovered by you. When you join our Talent Network, you're connecting to career resources that provide insights into working at Deloitte and potential job opportunities. Let's get started.

Adding value across the Legal Business Services spectrum
We provide a comprehensive suite of Legal Management Consulting and technologically enabled Legal Managed Services designed to transform the business of law. Learn more about our services

Deloitte Legal Business Services helps your team get beyond busy work. We can free you to focus on strategic priorities; enhance the speed and quality of issue identification; and use data to drive faster, more informed, and holistic decision-making.

The Deloitte US firms do not practice law or provide legal advice. Deloitte Legal refers to the legal practices of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited member firms (or their respective affiliates) that provide legal services outside of the United States.

Don Fancher is a Deloitte Risk & Financial Advisory Principal with Deloitte Financial Advisory Services LLP where he serves as the Global Leader of Deloitte Forensic as well as the Co-Leader of Deloit... More

Mark is a principal in Deloitte Tax LLP, and the Co-Leader of the firm's Legal Business Services practice. Legal Business Services leverages Deloitte’s global multi-disciplinary approach to provide in... More

Deloitte refers to one or more of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee ("DTTL"), its network of member firms, and their related entities. DTTL and each of its member firms are legally separate and independent entities. DTTL (also referred to as "Deloitte Global") does not provide services to clients. In the United States, Deloitte refers to one or more of the US member firms of DTTL, their related entities that operate using the "Deloitte" name in the United States and their respective affiliates. Certain services may not be available to attest clients under the rules and regulations of public accounting. Please see www.deloitte.com/about to learn more about our global network of member firms.
insight: Inspiring connections. Impactful work. All here. All waiting to be discovered by you. When you join our Talent Network, you're connecting to career resources that provide insights into working at Deloitte and potential job opportunities. Let's get started.

Our Chief Legal Officer (CLO) Program provides CLOs with tools and opportunities to meet business objectives, become strategic members of the C-suite, and lead successful teams. The CLO program also provides unique insights into the rapidly changing needs and expectations of corporate legal departments.

service: Deloitte refers to one or more of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee ("DTTL"), its network of member firms, and their related entities. The Deloitte Insights App Go straight to smart Download on the App Store (Apple) Download on Google Play Podcasts Listen anytime, anywhere Download on the App Store (Apple) Download on Google Play Follow us LinkedIn Follow Deloitte Insights on LinkedIn Issue 32 The new decision-making calculus Letter from the editor Elisabeth Sullivan Editor in chief, Deloitte Insights What does it take to make strategic decisions when the variables are proliferating? What lenses do leaders now need to apply when they’re determining the way
                                    forward on the given initiative? Consider the common factors that might go into today’s business decisions. Cost effectiveness and profitability. Increasing supply costs and margin pressure.
                                    Ever-increasing competition. The difficulty of gaining consensus among more participants in purchase decisions. The challenge of navigating risk and resilience
                                    imperatives amid the continuing crush of disruptions. Add to that the many workforce considerations, evolving ESG regulations, and much, much more as the complexity of the business landscape rapidly increases and the
                                    impact of each decision ripples outward. In this issue, we explore this new decision-making calculus, examining a handful of the variables many leaders now contend with, and offering proprietary data and
                                    fresh perspectives to help inform your next strategic decision. Learn more on how we developed this issue’s cover art Letter from the editor Elisabeth Sullivan Editor in chief, Deloitte Insights What does it take to make strategic decisions when the variables are proliferating? What lenses do leaders now need to apply when they’re determining the way forward on
                                the given initiative? Consider the common factors that might go into today’s business decisions. Cost effectiveness and profitability. Increasing supply costs and margin pressure.
                                Ever-increasing competition. The difficulty of gaining consensus among more participants in purchase decisions. The challenge of navigating risk and resilience
                                imperatives amid the continuing crush of disruptions. Add to that the many workforce considerations, evolving ESG regulations, and much, much more as the complexity of
                                the business landscape rapidly increases and the impact of each decision ripples outward. In this issue, we explore this new decision-making calculus, examining a handful of the variables many leaders now contend with, and offering proprietary data and fresh
                                perspectives to help inform your next strategic decision. Learn more on how we developed this issue’s cover art Features Being human in a digital world With growing calls to halt AI development and widespread cynicism over the metaverse, we need a framework for visionary businesses, regulators, and society to
                                        help shape the future of an internet that enhances, rather than supplants, our humanity. ARTICLE 19-MIN READ The rise of growth-oriented resilience roles An emerging category of roles dedicated to organizational resilience is putting growth front and center. ARTICLE 11-MIN READ Perspectives The game-changing magic of knowing when to quit It’s not always best to value grit or follow-through, says Annie Duke, a former professional poker player who knows a thing or two about when to fold her cards.
                                        She’s on a mission to help you get better at quitting. ARTICLE 9-MIN READ Global tax reform is coming—and CEOs need to be ready For multinational corporations and their leaders, the introduction of new Pillar Two global minimum tax rules requires a new approach to data gathering,
                                        compliance, and fundamental business strategy. ARTICLE 8-MIN READ Outcomes over outputs: Why productivity is no longer the metric that matters most Data shows we’re not as productive as we should be, despite rapid advances in technology. Maybe that’s because we’re measuring the wrong things. ARTICLE 8-MIN READ Overcoming the hurdles to integrating sustainability into business strategy Transforming to meet the demands of decarbonization takes more than ESG metrics. It takes governance—and guts. ARTICLE 15-MIN READ Six leader/worker disconnects affecting workplace well-being Workplace well-being remains a top organizational priority, but leaders’ well-being strategies are hindered by critical gaps between perception and reality. Shea, Jr. Center for

Full-service global mobility, technology, and rewards advisory business

The need for mobility is greater than ever. Employees want continued flexibility when it comes to where and how they work. Understanding and assessing the risks and opportunities that come with supporting a global workforce helps you stay in step with the demands of your business. Amp up your awareness of key topics around Global Employer Services with Deloitte's latest thinking.

jQuery(document).ready(function($) { //add dstory plugin $('#dstoryges-carousel').storiescarousel({ properties: { fragID: "dstoryges-carousel", numberOfItems: "12", // number of items in carousel : default 1 itemsVisible: "${items-visible}", // comma delimited string to override breakpoints (mobile,768,1024,1200) (ex: 1,2,3,4) : first option should always be 1 : default false categoryFilter: "${category-filter}", // show filter (true/false) : default false categoryLabel: "${category-label}" // category filter label text : default 'Select an industry:' }, items: [ { reorder: "j", // reorder-tile category: "${item1-category}", // category color: "${item1-color}", // category color photo: "/content/dam/Deloitte/us/Images/Misc/story-carousel/remote-work-pov-story-carousel.jpg", //photo (recommended 640x360px but can be taller if desired) header: "Into the After: The tech taking remote work strategies from policy to process", // header subheader: "${item1-subheader}", // subheader abstract: "${item1-abstract}", // abstract text fulltext: "

The push for remote work strategies didn’t begin in 2020. In the Before (i.e., prior to 2020), some employees had already been changing how they viewed work. They were getting tired of the hurry-up-and-wait dynamic of scrambling to get ready for work before sitting in traffic all the way to the office. The gas prices. The missed soccer games. The loss of productivity any time a family member got sick. A lot of people were starting to ask for new arrangements, and a lot of their employers were willing to give them a try.

The push for remote work strategies didn’t begin in 2020. In the Before (i.e., prior to 2020), some employees had already been changing how they viewed work. They were getting tired of the hurry-up-and-wait dynamic of scrambling to get ready for work before sitting in traffic all the way to the office. The gas prices. The missed soccer games. The loss of productivity any time a family member got sick. A lot of people were starting to ask for new arrangements, and a lot of their employers were willing to give them a try.

service: By industry, there was strong growth in construction but a decline in employment in the manufacturing sector. In addition, employment declined in retailing and increased only marginally in financial services, information, and wholesale trade. Moreover, employment fell sharply in professional and business services, largely reflecting a big decline in employment in temporary job services. In addition, there was a very small increase in employment in leisure and hospitality. On the other hand, there was a big increase in employment in health care and social assistance as well as in state and local government. Overall, job growth was relatively concentrated in a small number of industries.

Let’s look at the details: In May, real disposable personal income (income after inflation and taxes) was up 0.5% from the previous month, reflecting strong increases in wages after inflation. In addition, real personal consumption expenditures were up 0.3% from the previous month. The latter included a 1.1% real increase in spending on durable goods, a 0.3% gain for non-durable goods, and a 0.1% increase for services.

Regarding the PCE-deflator, overall prices were up 2.6% from a year earlier. When volatile food and energy prices are excluded, core prices were also up 2.6% from a year earlier, the lowest rate of core inflation since March 2021. By category, prices were down a sharp 3.2% for durable goods, up 1.6% for non-durable goods, and up 3.9% for services. While the latter number is one of the lowest in three years, it remains too high for the Fed’s comfort. Services are labor-intensive and wages continue to rise sharply amid a tight labor market.

Economists are divided as to when the Fed may start to cut rates. Some argue that the very low level of core inflation means that the Fed has largely achieved its goal. Others worry, however, that persistent services inflation will not abate until the economy softens. They suggest that sustained tight monetary policy will be needed to facilitate such an outcome.

One factor that explains the relatively low headline inflation rate is the 0.2% rate of inflation for energy. Food prices, meanwhile, were up 2.5% in June from a year earlier. Prices of non-energy industrial products were up a mere 0.7% in June from a year earlier while prices of services were up 4.1%. The latter number has barely moved in the last six months. This persistence of service inflation likely reflects the labor-intensive nature of services and the fact that tight labor markets are generating big wage increases. This is the principal concern of the ECB. Meanwhile, the European Union (EU) released data on employment in the Eurozone. It found that the Eurozone unemployment rate remained unchanged in May at an historically low 6.4%.

The recent persistence of service inflation could be attributable, in part, to the start of the tourism season and to the intense demand for major sporting and entertainment events (think Taylor Swift). Still, the ECB will closely watch the labor market for signs of rising or falling demand. It will also look at other factors such as labor productivity and migration, both of which can have a big impact on wages. ECB President Lagarde said that the policy committee will closely watch data, noting that it will “take time” to determine the direction of things.

The Bank for International Settlements (BIS), which is the central bankers’ central bank, has warned central banks not to loosen monetary policy too soon. In its annual report , the BIS noted considerable progress for the global economy in terms of inflation and growth, but said that serious risks remain, including the risk of policy failure. While inflation in major jurisdictions has declined, “the recent stickiness of inflation in some key jurisdictions reminds us that central banks’ job is not yet done.” It noted that, in major economies, inflation remains above central-bank targets. It expressed particular concern about persistent inflation in services. It said that “premature easing could reignite inflationary pressures and force a costly policy reversal—all the costlier because credibility would be undermined.”

Interestingly, BIS research indicates that the ratio of service prices to goods prices remains below the pre-pandemic level. This reflects the impact of the spurt in goods prices early in the pandemic. The BIS suggested that the current high inflation in services reflects a trend toward restoring the traditional relationship between the prices of services and goods. Unless there is further goods price deflation, it is likely that this process will entail overall inflation remaining above pre-pandemic levels for some time.

quote: Dr. Kalish is the Chief Global Economist of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Ltd. He is a specialist in global economic issues as well as the effects of economic, demographic, and social trends on the global business environment. He advises Deloitte clients as well as Deloitte’s leadership on economic issues and their impact on business strategy. In addition, he has given numerous presentations to corporations and trade organizations on topics related to the global economy. He is widely traveled and has given presentations in 47 countries on six continents. He has been quoted by the Wall Street Journal , The Economist , and The Financial Times . Dr. Kalish holds a bachelor’s degree in economics from Vassar College and a PhD in international economics from Johns Hopkins University.

The Deloitte Insights App Go straight to smart Download on the App Store (Apple) Download on Google Play Podcasts Listen anytime, anywhere Download on the App Store (Apple) Download on Google Play Follow us LinkedIn Follow Deloitte Insights on LinkedIn Issue 32 The new decision-making calculus Letter from the editor Elisabeth Sullivan Editor in chief, Deloitte Insights What does it take to make strategic decisions when the variables are proliferating? What lenses do leaders now need to apply when they’re determining the way
                                    forward on the given initiative? Consider the common factors that might go into today’s business decisions. Cost effectiveness and profitability. Increasing supply costs and margin pressure.
                                    Ever-increasing competition. The difficulty of gaining consensus among more participants in purchase decisions. The challenge of navigating risk and resilience
                                    imperatives amid the continuing crush of disruptions. Add to that the many workforce considerations, evolving ESG regulations, and much, much more as the complexity of the business landscape rapidly increases and the
                                    impact of each decision ripples outward. In this issue, we explore this new decision-making calculus, examining a handful of the variables many leaders now contend with, and offering proprietary data and
                                    fresh perspectives to help inform your next strategic decision. Learn more on how we developed this issue’s cover art Letter from the editor Elisabeth Sullivan Editor in chief, Deloitte Insights What does it take to make strategic decisions when the variables are proliferating? What lenses do leaders now need to apply when they’re determining the way forward on
                                the given initiative? Consider the common factors that might go into today’s business decisions. Cost effectiveness and profitability. Increasing supply costs and margin pressure.
                                Ever-increasing competition. The difficulty of gaining consensus among more participants in purchase decisions. The challenge of navigating risk and resilience
                                imperatives amid the continuing crush of disruptions. Add to that the many workforce considerations, evolving ESG regulations, and much, much more as the complexity of
                                the business landscape rapidly increases and the impact of each decision ripples outward. In this issue, we explore this new decision-making calculus, examining a handful of the variables many leaders now contend with, and offering proprietary data and fresh
                                perspectives to help inform your next strategic decision. Learn more on how we developed this issue’s cover art Features Being human in a digital world With growing calls to halt AI development and widespread cynicism over the metaverse, we need a framework for visionary businesses, regulators, and society to
                                        help shape the future of an internet that enhances, rather than supplants, our humanity. ARTICLE 19-MIN READ The rise of growth-oriented resilience roles An emerging category of roles dedicated to organizational resilience is putting growth front and center. ARTICLE 11-MIN READ Perspectives The game-changing magic of knowing when to quit It’s not always best to value grit or follow-through, says Annie Duke, a former professional poker player who knows a thing or two about when to fold her cards.
                                        She’s on a mission to help you get better at quitting. ARTICLE 9-MIN READ Global tax reform is coming—and CEOs need to be ready For multinational corporations and their leaders, the introduction of new Pillar Two global minimum tax rules requires a new approach to data gathering,
                                        compliance, and fundamental business strategy. ARTICLE 8-MIN READ Outcomes over outputs: Why productivity is no longer the metric that matters most Data shows we’re not as productive as we should be, despite rapid advances in technology. Maybe that’s because we’re measuring the wrong things. ARTICLE 8-MIN READ Overcoming the hurdles to integrating sustainability into business strategy Transforming to meet the demands of decarbonization takes more than ESG metrics. It takes governance—and guts. ARTICLE 15-MIN READ Six leader/worker disconnects affecting workplace well-being Workplace well-being remains a top organizational priority, but leaders’ well-being strategies are hindered by critical gaps between perception and reality. ARTICLE 6-MIN READ Data points Contributors Gerald C. Kane is a visiting scholar at Harvard Business School, and a professor of information systems and the faculty director of the Edmund H. Shea, Jr. Center for
                                        Entrepreneurship at Boston College. He has authored more than 100 papers dealing with the implications of digital technologies on organizations for both
                                        academic and practitioner audiences. jQuery(document).ready(function($) {
        
        
        //add dstory plugin
        $('#dstoryinsurance-story-carousels').storiescarousel({
            properties: {
                fragID: "dstoryinsurance-story-carousels",
                numberOfItems: "21", // number of items in carousel : default 1
                itemsVisible: "1,2,3,3", // comma delimited string to override breakpoints (mobile,768,1024,1200) (ex: 1,2,3,4) : first option should always be 1 : default false
                categoryFilter: "${category-filter}", // show filter (true/false) : default false
                categoryLabel: "${category-label}" // category filter label text : default 'Select an industry:'
            },
            items: [
                {
					reorder: "g", // reorder-tile
                    category: "${item1-category}", // category
                    color: "${item1-color}", // category color
                    photo: "/content/dam/Deloitte/us/Images/Misc/story-carousel/bridging_homeowners_insurance_gap_640x360.jpg", //photo (recommended 640x360px but can be taller if desired)
                    header: "Bridging insurance gaps to prepare homeowners for emerging climate change risks", // header
                    subheader: "${item1-subheader}", // subheader
                    abstract: "Deloitte’s survey of homeowners in US states with high climate change risk reveals skyrocketing costs and widening gaps in insurance coverage.", // abstract text
                    fulltext: "${item1-fulltext}", // escaped html text for expanded item
                    youtube: "${item1-youtube}", // youtube video url
                    readmoreText: "Learn more", // link text otherwise "Read more"

By bringing together insights, experience, and talent, we can provide advice and recommendations to organizations in addressing their gaps in application and operational performance while improving service and cost levels. In addition to delivering flexible staffing, reduced operating cost, efficient process execution, and access to leading-edge technology, like Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI), we provide domain experience to help you build new capabilities and support strategic priorities.
Application, Cloud, and Infrastructure Operate Services
AI, Data, and Insights Operate Services
Industry Solutions and Process Enablement Operate Services

Evolution points to experimentation and even risk-taking as the main drivers behind today’s innovation, competitive distinction, and profitable growth. Yet risk-taking requires vigilance, and that’s what our teams provide to clients: Enhanced cross-business services across the three interrelated areas of risk, capital, and regulatory on a variety of issues challenging the insurance industry. Our teams can advise your organization as you address financial risks, operational risks, capital concepts, and regulatory requirements—helping you to turn these complex challenges into opportunities for growth.
Enterprise Compliance Risk Management Services | Deloitte US
Risk and Capital Management Services | Deloitte US

Insurance data as a strategic asset | Deloitte Insights

Insight is evolving into foresight as transformational solutions create leading finance and actuarial capabilities to address both traditional and emerging issues. As insurers seek increased business portfolio resilience to address profitability pressures, we can provide leading practices to advise finance and actuarial professionals in elevating their strategic advisory abilities and drive transformation across the finance value chain. As technological advancements become more robust, we can advise as you select and architect your technology landscape to better serve the broader organization.

By bringing together insights, experience, and talent, we can provide advice and recommendations to organizations in addressing their gaps in application and operational performance while improving service and cost levels. In addition to delivering flexible staffing, reduced operating cost, efficient process execution, and access to leading-edge technology, like Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI), we provide domain experience to help you build new capabilities and support strategic priorities.
AI, Data, and Insights Operate Services
Inclusive and sustainable insurance | Deloitte Insights
ESG for insurance companies | Deloitte Insights

For more insights on insurance, innovation, and digital transformation, visit my.deloitte.com to create your own personalized feed and enroll in email and newsletter updates. Once you're signed in and set up, you’ll have access to a robust content library of news, industry-specific takeaways, and topics of interest that will help you stay one step ahead.

service: The future of financial services is a “higher” bottom line.
Welcome to a new era of financial services.
Dedicated to providing services for your team and your business to help make the world a better place.
Emerging developments and trends in the financial services industry
Emerging developments and trends in the financial services industry

Deloitte is committed to being the provider of choice for industry leaders and
                    organizations aspiring to shape and lead the future of financial services.
Financial services in an era of discontinuities

The first computers designed for business use were introduced to the workplace nearly 70 years ago. Today, a steady stream of innovative technological and scientific developments is constantly ushering in new breakthroughs that continue to impact the financial services sector—where trust is fundamental and security is essential. At this rate, how will the world in 2030 differ from our world today?
The digital transformation of financial services organizations is extending into ecosystems, introducing new players and shifting traditional roles.
To help mitigate the effects of global warming, the financial services industry can play an integral role in bringing climate innovations and technologies to the world.

Deloitte refers to one or more of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee ("DTTL"), its network of member firms, and their related entities. DTTL and each of its member firms are legally separate and independent entities. DTTL (also referred to as "Deloitte Global") does not provide services to clients. In the United States, Deloitte refers to one or more of the US member firms of DTTL, their related entities that operate using the "Deloitte" name in the United States and their respective affiliates. Certain services may not be available to attest clients under the rules and regulations of public accounting. Please see www.deloitte.com/about to learn more about our global network of member firms.
insight: Inspiring connections. Impactful work. All here. All waiting to be discovered by you. When you join our Talent Network, you're connecting to career resources that provide insights into working at Deloitte and potential job opportunities. Let's get started.

Deloitte IndustryAdvantage offers deep industry insights with cutting-edge digital capabilities to position your business for the future. Explore how we can help you face your commercial, product, and operations challenges and gain a competitive advantage.

jQuery(document).ready(function($) {
        
        
        //add dstory plugin
        $('#dstorystory-carousel-latest').storiescarousel({
            properties: {
                fragID: "dstorystory-carousel-latest",
                numberOfItems: "20", // number of items in carousel : default 1
                itemsVisible: "1,2,3,3", // comma delimited string to override breakpoints (mobile,768,1024,1200) (ex: 1,2,3,4) : first option should always be 1 : default false
                categoryFilter: "${category-filter}", // show filter (true/false) : default false
                categoryLabel: "${category-label}" // category filter label text : default 'Select an industry:'
            },
            items: [
                {
					reorder: "${item1-reorder}", // reorder-tile
                    category: "${item1-category}", // category
                    color: "${item1-color}", // category color
                    photo: "/content/dam/Deloitte/us/Images/Misc/story-carousel/us-in-app-payments.png", //photo (recommended 640x360px but can be taller if desired)
                    header: "In-app payments should take social commerce to the next level", // header
                    subheader: "${item1-subheader}", // subheader
                    abstract: "As social media platforms gear up to support consumers’ shopping journeys from discovery to checkout, payments firms can help deliver safer and more convenient experiences.", // abstract text
                    fulltext: "${item1-fulltext}", // escaped html text for expanded item
                    youtube: "${item1-youtube}", // youtube video url
                    readmoreText: "Learn more", // link text otherwise "Read more"
                    readmoreLink: "/content/www/us/en/insights/industry/financial-services/financial-services-industry-predictions.html", // if present this will override the window expansion      
                    ctaText: "${item1-cta-text}", // cta text in expanded item text otherwise "Read more" | cta is not displayed unless url is set
                    ctaLink: "${item1-cta-url}", // cta link in expanded item
                    newWindow: "true" // will link open in a new window? default = false
                },
                {
					reorder: "${item2-reorder}", 
                    category: "${item2-category}",
                    color: "${item2-color}",
                    photo: "/content/dam/Deloitte/us/Images/Misc/story-carousel/us-gen-ai.png",
                    header: "Generative AI is expected to magnify the risk of deepfakes and other fraud in banking",
                    subheader: "${item2-subheader}",
                    abstract: "Fake content has never been easier to create—or harder to catch. As threats grow, banks can invest in AI and other technologies to help detect fraud and prevent losses.",
                    fulltext: "${item2-fulltext}",
                    youtube: "${item2-youtube}",
                    readmoreText: "Learn more",
                    readmoreLink: "/content/www/us/en/insights/industry/financial-services/financial-services-industry-predictions/2024/deepfake-banking-fraud-risk-on-the-rise.html", 
                    ctaText: "${item2-cta-text}", 
                    ctaLink: "${item2-cta-url}",
                    newWindow: "true"
                },
                {
					reorder: "${item3-reorder}", 
                    category: "${item3-category}",
                    color: "${item3-color}",
                    photo: "/content/dam/Deloitte/us/Images/Misc/story-carousel/story-bcm.jpg",
                    header: "Data evolution in banking",
                    subheader: "${item3-subheader}",
                    abstract: "We asked around 150 senior US banking personnel about their priorities and challenges when it comes to data. The results are illuminating. Explore highlights from the Banking & Capital Markets Data and Analytics Market Survey and learn which trends to watch to prepare for tomorrow.",
                    fulltext: "${item3-fulltext}",
                    youtube: "${item3-youtube}",
                    readmoreText: "Learn more",
                    readmoreLink: "/content/www/us/en/pages/consulting/articles/2024-banking-data-analytics-survey-insights.html", 
                    ctaText: "${item3-cta-text}", 
                    ctaLink: "${item3-cta-url}",
                    newWindow: "true" 
                },
                {
					reorder: "${item4-reorder}", 
                    category: "${item4-category}",
                    color: "${item4-color}",
                    photo: "/content/dam/Deloitte/us/Images/Misc/story-carousel/graph-blue-trends.jpg",
                    header: "ISO 20022: Preparing for US readiness",
                    subheader: "${item4-subheader}",
                    abstract: "ISO 20022 is here—is your organization ready for migration? Explore readiness options, implementation challenges, and key considerations to maximize your ISO 20022 adoption journey.",
                    fulltext: "${item4-fulltext}",
                    youtube: "${item4-youtube}",
                    readmoreText: "Learn more",
                    readmoreLink: "/content/www/us/en/pages/consulting/articles/preparing-for-iso-20022-migration.html", 
                    ctaText: "${item4-cta-text}",

Regulatory compliance and legal support services

Regulatory compliance and legal support
                      services
Finance, risk, and regulatory data and analytics services

Acquisitions can be a strategic lever for achieving growth and innovation objectives,
                                  while regularly assessing product and capabilities portfolios and divesting
                                  underperforming assets is (or should be) standard operating procedure for banks and
                                  capital markets organizations. Deloitte is a one-stop shop for guidance throughout the
                                  deal life cycle, with services ranging from M&A strategy and due diligence to post-close
                                  transition, delivering these services through a risk-intelligent, integrated approach
                                  alongside the unique combination of skills your deal requires.

In today’s dynamic business and regulatory environment, financial services firms
                                  (including banks and nonbanks that offer banking products and services) are exploring
                                  new options to achieve their business objectives, including licenses, new entity setup,
                                  legal entity optimization, and product launch opportunities (e.g., new platform launch,
                                  digital assets). Through combined breadth of knowledge and experience, as well as a
                                  suite of industry-tested tools, platforms, and accelerators, Deloitte can help by
                                  guiding you through your strategic needs, from developing a business model strategy to
                                  implementing new technologies, designing the target-state operating model and technology
                                  architecture, navigating regulatory nuances, and implementation of the technology to
                                  support it.

Strategies
                                      for navigating business model and regulatory complexities in financial services

In an increasingly complex business environment, Deloitte can deliver the audit and
                                  assurance services that clients in the banking and capital markets sector need to keep
                                  pace with accelerating change. From accounting and reporting to control services,
                                  financial statement audits, and advisory services such as finance transformation and
                                  environmental, social, and governance (ESG) strategy—Deloitte provides experienced
                                  professionals and innovative technology to meet audit and assurance challenges specific
                                  to banking and capital markets. Our clients benefit from locally focused service that
                                  also draws from considerable national and global resources and industry expertise to
                                  meet fast-moving, industry-specific requirements.

Audit
                                      & Assurance services for the financial services industry
Regulatory compliance and legal support services
Regulatory compliance and legal support services

Regardless of your most urgent need, our paradigm is vigilance: helping clients enhance
                                  their risk and compliance operations across first and second lines of defense, including
                                  conduct risk and surveillance. Deloitte’s regulatory and legal services are dedicated to
                                  helping organizations in their efforts to achieve regulatory and legal compliance and
                                  transform their departments to add greater value to the business. Our in-depth
                                  experience takes the complexity out of enterprise compliance. And Deloitte combines
                                  highly specialized skills in discovery and data management, corporate investigations,
                                  anti-money laundering, Foreign Corrupt Practices Act, and anti-fraud with financial
                                  acumen and advanced analytics to produce transformative insights.
Regulatory compliance and legal support services leaders:

Irena
                                          Gecas-McCarthy , US Financial Services Industry Center for Regulatory
                                      Strategy Leader
Tax Services for the Banking and Securities Industry

HR Transformation: Deloitte’s HR Transformation services can help drive business value
                                  through strategy, the cloud, employee engagement tools, advanced workforce planning, and
                                  analytics.

Workforce Transformation: Our Workforce Transformation services can help you reimagine
                                  your talent management strategies across leadership, learning, rewards, inclusion,
                                  performance management, career mobility, and talent acquisition.

Human Capital as a Service: Human Capital as a Service can help HR leaders to not only
                                  drive organizational performance but also sustain it, through our in-depth insights,
                                  access to leading specialists, and subscription-based software.

Organization Transformation: Our Organization Transformation services can help you bring
                                  these key success factors together under a unified strategy, harnessing change and data
                                  across the enterprise to proactively manage risk, support growth, and improve
                                  operational efficiency.

		  } else {
			return 1;
		  }
		}).appendTo('#dstorystory-carousel-latest .dstory-slider');	
        
    });

Technology is accelerating the evolution of finance from providing insight to foresight.
                                  Learn how Deloitte can help you rethink how to address traditional and emerging issues.

Regardless of your most urgent need, our paradigm is vigilance: helping clients enhance
                                  their risk and compliance operations across first and second lines of defense, including
                                  conduct risk and surveillance. Deloitte’s regulatory and legal services are dedicated to
                                  helping organizations in their efforts to achieve regulatory and legal compliance and
                                  transform their departments to add greater value to the business. Our in-depth
                                  experience takes the complexity out of enterprise compliance. And Deloitte combines
                                  highly specialized skills in discovery and data management, corporate investigations,
                                  anti-money laundering, Foreign Corrupt Practices Act, and anti-fraud with financial
                                  acumen and advanced analytics to produce transformative insights.

Human Capital as a Service: Human Capital as a Service can help HR leaders to not only
                                  drive organizational performance but also sustain it, through our in-depth insights,
                                  access to leading specialists, and subscription-based software.

For more insights on banking and capital markets and other financial services solutions, visit my.deloitte.com to create your own personalized feed and enroll in email and newsletter updates. Once you're signed in and set up, you’ll have access to a robust content library of news, industry-specific takeaways, and topics of interest that will help you stay one step ahead.
Sharing insights, events, research, and more

jQuery(document).ready(function($) {
        
        
        //add dstory plugin
        $('#dstorytbd-story-carousel').storiescarousel({
            properties: {
                fragID: "dstorytbd-story-carousel",
                numberOfItems: "25", // number of items in carousel : default 1
                itemsVisible: "1,2,3,3", // comma delimited string to override breakpoints (mobile,768,1024,1200) (ex: 1,2,3,4) : first option should always be 1 : default false
                categoryFilter: "${category-filter}", // show filter (true/false) : default false
                categoryLabel: "${category-label}" // category filter label text : default 'Select an industry:'
            },
            items: [
                {
					reorder: "b", // reorder-tile
                    category: "${item1-category}", // category
                    color: "${item1-color}", // category color

                    header: "2024 investment management regulatory outlook", // header
                    subheader: "${item1-subheader}", // subheader
                    abstract: "Explore our 2024 investment management regulatory outlook to see how you can guard your firm against regulatory risk now.", // abstract text
                    fulltext: "${item1-fulltext}", // escaped html text for expanded item
                    youtube: "${item1-youtube}", // youtube video url
                    readmoreText: "Read more", // link text otherwise "Read more"
                    readmoreLink: "/content/www/us/en/pages/regulatory/articles/investment-management-regulatory-outlook.html", // if present this will override the window expansion

                    header: "Making the investment decision process more naturally intelligent",

Deloitte refers to one or more of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee ("DTTL"), its network of member firms, and their related entities. DTTL and each of its member firms are legally separate and independent entities. DTTL (also referred to as "Deloitte Global") does not provide services to clients. In the United States, Deloitte refers to one or more of the US member firms of DTTL, their related entities that operate using the "Deloitte" name in the United States and their respective affiliates. Certain services may not be available to attest clients under the rules and regulations of public accounting. Please see www.deloitte.com/about to learn more about our global network of member firms.

Technology is accelerating the evolution of finance from providing insight to foresight.
                                We can help you re-envision how corporate functions deliver services with a
                                comprehensive solution that provides a seamless consumer-grade experience, connects
                                disparate but connected functions across the company, and empowers people to focus on
                                business priorities.

Data and analytics continue to underpin both offensive and defensive strategies at
                                financial institutions—spanning customer centricity and infrastructure modernization
                                while remaining compliant with risk and regulatory priorities. As organizations are
                                moving toward adoption of advanced technologies and analytical capabilities, we can help
                                you better navigate the challenges of an evolving competitive landscape by enabling
                                insight-driven decision-making and business value for stakeholders.

By bringing together insights, experience, and talent, we can help organizations address
                                key gaps and help our clients improve service and cost levels. We've redesigned our
                                investment management outsourcing services to impart outcomes-based help: scalable,
                                technology-enabled, experience-driven, operationally integrated, strategic services that
                                can assist you no matter the challenges you face.

Omnia DNAV: Achieving a more insightful audit shouldn't take more effort from you. Omnia
                                DNAV transforms investment auditing and portfolio valuation with multiple cutting-edge,
                                cloud-based technologies that significantly reduce the audit burden on your team. Omnia
                                DNAV saves you time while delivering insights, quality, and transparency with scale and
                                speed.

Just when investment managers were getting used to doing business under extreme
                                pressures, a new level of complexity has emerged. Deloitte Tax LLP can help investment
                                managers rise to the challenges and capitalize on opportunities by providing specialized
                                knowledge on the wide range of tax operational, technological and regulatory issues
                                surrounding the industry. With the added strength of the Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu
                                Limited (DTTL) member firm network, Deloitte has the ability to offer a global,
                                integrated approach to tax business issues that combines insight and innovation from
                                multiple disciplines with a wide range of tax business and industry knowledge to help
                                organizations excel around the world.

For more insights into Investment Management and other financial topics, visit my.deloitte.com to create your own personalized feed and enroll in email and newsletter updates. Once you're signed in and set up, you’ll have access to a robust content library of news, industry-specific takeaways, and topics of interest that will help you stay one step ahead.

Deloitte refers to one or more of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee ("DTTL"), its network of member firms, and their related entities. DTTL and each of its member firms are legally separate and independent entities. DTTL (also referred to as "Deloitte Global") does not provide services to clients. In the United States, Deloitte refers to one or more of the US member firms of DTTL, their related entities that operate using the "Deloitte" name in the United States and their respective affiliates. Certain services may not be available to attest clients under the rules and regulations of public accounting. Please see www.deloitte.com/about to learn more about our global network of member firms.

In the consumer transportation and hospitality industry, organizational values and purpose have become as important as service. Deloitte offers the strategies, insights, and tools for travel and hospitality brands to better serve your customers—so they can buy into your vision for a better future.
Frontline workforce management for transportation, hospitality, and services

Transportation, hospitality, and services companies—seeking growth—look to respond to the challenges of an increasingly multi-channel environment. As travel and hospitality companies grow, providing superior customer engagement and personalized experience remains a key focus area.
Risk & Financial Advisory Services and Perspectives
Audit & Assurance Services for the Consumer Industry

For consumer-oriented businesses, public perception is a brand’s reality. Deloitte & Touche LLP’s Audit & Assurance practice is focused on quality and innovation—using leading-edge technologies and highly talented professionals to deliver high-quality audit and assurance services.

Deloitte refers to one or more of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee ("DTTL"), its network of member firms, and their related entities. DTTL and each of its member firms are legally separate and independent entities. DTTL (also referred to as "Deloitte Global") does not provide services to clients. In the United States, Deloitte refers to one or more of the US member firms of DTTL, their related entities that operate using the "Deloitte" name in the United States and their respective affiliates. Certain services may not be available to attest clients under the rules and regulations of public accounting. Please see www.deloitte.com/about to learn more about our global network of member firms.
